plugins.name: Heurator
plugins.description:
Elevate your design critique process with Heurator, a powerful Figma plugin that brings Nielsen's 10 Usability Heuristics directly into your workflow.


Document, visualize, and solve usability issues with precision—all without leaving your design files.


✓ Pinpoint violations with customizable severity ratings

✓ Generate visually striking evaluation cards linked to problem areas

✓ Create actionable recommendations to improve user experience

✓ Maintain consistent evaluation criteria across your team


Even in the age of AI-generated interfaces, human-centered heuristic evaluation remains essential. While AI excels at creating visually appealing designs, it often misses nuanced usability concerns that experienced designers catch. Heurator bridges this gap by helping you apply proven principles to any interface—whether human or AI-designed—ensuring truly intuitive experiences.


Transform complex usability principles into practical insights and deliver more thoughtful, user-centered designs with Heurator.
plugins.tagline: Because Even AI-Generated UIs Need Human-Centered Evaluation

plugins.name: Fieldnotes
plugins.description:
Fieldnotes transforms in-person workshop sticky notes into digital boards.


Simply take photos of your sticky notes using your phone (you just have to scan a QR code to sync) or upload images directly to the plugin. Your physical sticky notes are instantly recreated in your board, preserving the texts, colors, position, and all your ideas :)


Fieldnotes combines several AI recognition technologies to boost accuracy and to detect even messy handwriting across multiple languages.

Pro users gain access to powerful AI-enhanced features including text improvement, grammar correction, and automatic workshop summaries.


Transform raw workshop notes into polished, actionable content and generate comprehensive takeaways to share with stakeholders, a dream follow-up!


If you want to learn more about the plugin or simply because you are passionate about Product or collaboration, feel free to reach out
plugins.tagline: Fieldnotes transforms pictures of sticky notes into stickies — ready to share, without the hassle

plugins.name: Create Red Rectangle Plugin
plugins.description:
Objective: Implement functionality where clicking a button creates a red rectangle on the workspace.


Implementation Plan:


Creating the Interface:


Add a button labeled "Create Rectangle."

Prepare a canvas or container where the rectangle will appear.

Styling Elements:


Define styles for the button (e.g., color, shape).

Set default dimensions and properties for the rectangle (e.g., width, height, background color).

Programming Logic:


Write an event handler for the button: on click, create an element with predefined properties (e.g., width, height, color).

Append this element to the container on the page.

Testing the Functionality:


Ensure the red rectangle appears correctly and only when the button is clicked.

Optionally, add features such as slightly offsetting the position of each new rectangle.
plugins.tagline: Rectangle

plugins.name: Move Outside
plugins.description:
A plugin designed to move any elements outside of their current frames and place them at the top of the hierarchy while retaining their original position relative to the entire page. The plugin offers two modes:


  1. Default - Moves selected single or multiple elements to the top of the page’s layer hierarchy.
  2. Locked Target - Moves selected single or multiple elements into another specified layer. The Locked Target mode supports moving into frames, frames with autolayout, and sections. If the Locked Target is an autolayout frame, users can choose whether the moved frames should retain their original page position using absolute positioning or adapt to the autolayout.


This plugin stands out from others with similar functionality by offering a full interface that enables continuous management of complex layer structures.
plugins.tagline: A plugin used to move elements to the top of the layer hierarchy or to other frames/sections.

plugins.name: コーディング計算ツール
plugins.description:
レイヤーから取得できる数値をコーディングで使用する数値に自動計算します。

あなたのコーディング作業が少しでも楽になりますように。


【行間の倍率変換】

テキストレイヤーを選択すると文字サイズと行間を取得して倍率値に変換します。

以下の場合は計算できません。

  1. 行間がautoの場合
  2. オートレイアウト、グループ化レイヤーを選択
  3. テキストレイヤー以外のレイヤーを選択


【単位変換】

px値を別の単位に変換します。

各単位共通でテキストレイヤーなら文字サイズを取得し、その他のレイヤーなら横幅を取得しますが、単位ごとに連動するフィールドが異なります。


em：

レイヤーを選択すると「基準値」が変動します。

rem：

レイヤーを選択すると「変換したいpx値」が変動します。基準値は16が初期値になります。

%：

レイヤーを選択すると「基準値」が変動します。

vw：

レイヤーを選択すると「基準値」と「変換したいpx値」が変動します。

「基準値」は一番外側のフレームサイズになり、「変換したいpx値」は選択中のレイヤーの数値になります。


【clamp関数】

レイヤーから数値を取得して、clamp(最小値, 推奨値, 最大値)の形式で出力します。

フレームサイズが700px以下の場合は最小値と最小画面幅が、701px以上だと最大値と最大画面幅が連動し、レイヤーから数値を取得します。emとremは基準値も設定できます。


【その他共通仕様】

  1. 結果をクリックでクリップボードにコピーします。
  2. 「値変動」をOFFにするとレイヤーからの取得をやめ、普通の計算機になります。
  3. 出力結果が小数点になる場合は少数第3位まで表示します。
plugins.tagline: コーディングで使用する数値に変換する補助ツール。

plugins.name: 10x HTML | Design to clean responsive code 10x faster
plugins.description:
⚡️ Instantly turn your Figma design into clean, responsive HTML / CSS / SCSS

🚀 No registration, no paywall, click and get your code

🔍 Preview / inspect the generated code in Figma

⚡️ Test responsiveness and make live adjustments

🎓 Smart layout and naming



Who is it for ?


  1. Beginner looking to turn a design into a website starting from a clean structure where 90% of the work is already handled


  1. Advanced front-end developers looking to drastically speed up their workflow without compromising on the structure and readability of their code.


No registration required - run the plugin, select a frame and preview the result in a single click.

Works in design mode only (for now, but let us know if you're interested for dev mode)



What is 10x HTML ?


Most design-to-code tools generate bloated or messy output, with non optimized layout.

That’s because extracting logic from a visual design — especially an unstructured one — is a hard problem..


10x HTML was built from the ground up with the clear goal of solving those issues with smart rules and layout inference.


We focus on :

- Understanding layout intent

- Reducing unnecessary nesting

- Recognizing repeated patterns (even copy-pasted ones)

- Grouping elements intelligently

- and more...


10x HTML doesn't claim to replace a frontend developer — but it dramatically accelerates your workflow by giving you clean, factorized and structured code that you can build on.


Whether you're a beginner or an experienced front-end developer, 10xHTML is designed to handle most of the heavy lifting for you—making smart assumptions when needed and delivering perfect code with clear naming and structure that’s easy to build upon.


Clean, semantic code – without the mess

- Converts buttons, inputs, headers, and more into proper HTML elements

- Uses a smart class system: base classes, modifiers, and utilities based on context

- Picks optimized class names

- Flattens overly nested layers


Smart, responsive export

- Fully responsive by default — includes media and container queries

- Detects and links similar elements, even without components

- Intelligently groups and infers layout, even from unstructured designs


Live code and layout inspection

- Preview the final webpage right in Figma

- Test responsiveness

- Do live update to adjust the code

- Download the code and get ready for production


How to reach out ?

💬 Request support here

💡 Suggest an improvement here

🕷 Report a bug here

🚀 Join our Discord for support, feedback or questions..


⚠️ Note :

10x HTML is currently free and fully accessible as a Beta version.

We are trying to gather as much feedback as possible, so please feel free to post any kind of comments (bug report, idea, opinion...)

Once we reach the level of maturity we’re aiming for, we will switch to a paid model

(with very reasonable pricing)
plugins.tagline: Convert your design to high quality HTML / CSS / SCSS in one click and download your code.

plugins.name: Text Auto Fill
plugins.description:
Figma Plugin User Guide for Beginners


What It Does

This Figma plugin lets you update text and hide layers in selected frames or instances. It’s easy to use with a text-based configuration for both specific and global changes.


How to Use It

  1. Select a Frame or Instance: In Figma, click a frame or instance to edit.
  2. Open the Plugin: Run the plugin from Figma’s menu (Plugins > Your Plugin Name).
  3. Enter Configuration: In the plugin window, type instructions to change text or hide layers (see examples below).
  4. Click Run: The plugin applies your changes instantly.


Configuration Examples

• Change Specific Text: To update text in a layer named title inside a frame named block, type:

block.title: Hello World

This sets the title layer’s text to "Hello World".


• Change Text Globally: To update all layers named text in any frame, type:

text: Welcome

This changes every text layer’s text to "Welcome".


• Hide a Specific Layer: To hide a layer named subtitle in the block frame, type:

//block.subtitle

This hides the subtitle layer.


• Hide a Layer Globally: To hide all layers named icon, type:

//icon

This hides every icon layer.


• Rename a Frame: To rename a frame named block, type:

$Title block: New Frame Name

This renames the frame to "New Frame Name".


• Combine Actions: Mix specific and global changes, like:

block.title: Welcome
text: Hello
//block.subtitle
//icon

This updates block.title to "Welcome", all text layers to "Hello", hides block.subtitle, and hides all icon layers.


Tips

  1. Write one instruction per line.
  2. Layer names must match exactly (case-sensitive).
  3. Select at least one frame or instance, or you’ll get an error.
plugins.tagline: Automatically update text in frames with key-value data

135574.name: Text Auto Fill
135574.description:
Figma Plugin User Guide for Beginners


What It Does

This Figma plugin lets you update text and hide layers in selected frames or instances. It’s easy to use with a text-based configuration for both specific and global changes.


How to Use It

  1. Select a Frame or Instance: In Figma, click a frame or instance to edit.
  2. Open the Plugin: Run the plugin from Figma’s menu (Plugins > Your Plugin Name).
  3. Enter Configuration: In the plugin window, type instructions to change text or hide layers (see examples below).
  4. Click Run: The plugin applies your changes instantly.


Configuration Examples

• Change Specific Text: To update text in a layer named title inside a frame named block, type:

block.title: Hello World

This sets the title layer’s text to "Hello World".


• Change Text Globally: To update all layers named text in any frame, type:

text: Welcome

This changes every text layer’s text to "Welcome".


• Hide a Specific Layer: To hide a layer named subtitle in the block frame, type:

//block.subtitle

This hides the subtitle layer.


• Hide a Layer Globally: To hide all layers named icon, type:

//icon

This hides every icon layer.


• Rename a Frame: To rename a frame named block, type:

$Title block: New Frame Name

This renames the frame to "New Frame Name".


• Combine Actions: Mix specific and global changes, like:

block.title: Welcome
text: Hello
//block.subtitle
//icon

This updates block.title to "Welcome", all text layers to "Hello", hides block.subtitle, and hides all icon layers.


Tips

  1. Write one instruction per line.
  2. Layer names must match exactly (case-sensitive).
  3. Select at least one frame or instance, or you’ll get an error.
135574.tagline: Automatically update text in frames with key-value data

plugins.name: Yet Another Design Linter
plugins.description:
✨ Yet Another Design Linter (YADL): Your Design System's Enforcer

YADL is the essential Figma plugin for teams who care about consistency, scalability, and design system integrity. Automate linting, enforce variable use, and ship cleaner designs—fast.


🚀 Why use it?

Design systems aren't just style guides—they're contracts. YADL automates enforcing those contracts so you're not stuck playing pixel cop.


🔍 What it does:

• Variable-Aware Linting + Auto-Fix: Instantly checks padding, gap, radius, stroke width, fills, strokes, effects, and typography—flags rogue values and suggests or auto-applies matching design tokens.


• Smart Error Grouping: See issues grouped by type and value with intelligent prioritization; focus on what matters most.


• Typography Linting: Comprehensive checks for font family, size, weight, line height, and letter spacing consistency.


• Deleted Variable Detection: Identifies broken variable references and optionally auto-detaches them to prevent errors.


• Component Structure Analysis: Detects nested components that may cause performance issues.


• Accessibility Checks: Flags common a11y pitfalls for inclusive design.


• Flexible Layer Filtering: Configurable options to include/exclude hidden or locked layers.


• Strict Linting Mode: Enhanced validation rules for production-ready designs.


• Variable Collection Control: Choose which variable collections to include in suggestions.


• Persistent UI State: Remembers window size and settings for smoother workflow.


• Precise Value Suggestions: See exact px values next to each suggestion—no guessing.


• Resizable, Accessible UI: Resize handle + full keyboard navigation for better UX.


🚦 It detects:

✅ Generic layer names (e.g., "Frame 1", "Rectangle 2")

✅ Absolute positioning inside auto layout

✅ All padding types (left, right, top, bottom, horizontal, vertical) not using variables

✅ Gap, border radius, stroke width not using variables

✅ Fill colors, stroke colors, effects not using variables

✅ Typography properties (font family, size, weight, line height, letter spacing) not using variables

✅ Broken variable references from deleted design tokens

✅ Nested components causing potential performance issues

✅ Issues in hidden or locked layers (configurable)


🎨 How it works:

1. Run the plugin in your Figma file.

2. Review errors categorized by type (Core Design, Spacing & Layout, Visual Properties, Typography, Variable Management, Component Structure).

3. Apply auto-suggestions with one click or fix issues manually.

4. Configure settings to match your team's workflow and design system.


💡 Who it's for:

• Designers who care about clean, token-driven files

• Teams enforcing scalable, maintainable design systems

• Design system managers ensuring consistency across projects

• Developers who need structured, handoff-ready designs

• Teams transitioning to variable-based design workflows


🎯 Perfect for:

• Design system audits and cleanup

• Onboarding new team members to design standards

• Pre-handoff quality checks

• Maintaining design token consistency at scale


Made with ❤️ for the Adtraction design team by Jonatan D. Bjerrekær.


YADL: Keep your Figma files clean, scalable, and system-perfect—automatically.
plugins.tagline: Keep your Figma files clean, consistent, and design-system perfect—automatically.

138051.release_notes:
Enhance variable resolution and introduce new preview components

- Refactor the VariableCollectionService to improve variable alias resolution, implementing a recursive function to handle circular references and ensure accurate value retrieval.
- Introduce new preview components for various design properties, including ColorPreview, TypographyPreview, EffectsPreview, OpacityPreview, RadiusPreview, SpacingPreview, and StrokePreview, enhancing the visual representation of design variables.
- Update the StyleList and VariableList components to utilize the new preview components, improving the user experience by providing clear visual feedback for different variable types.
- Enhance CSS styles for the new preview components, ensuring consistency and responsiveness across different screen sizes.
- Implement additional props in relevant components to support remote and local variable indications, improving clarity for users regarding variable origins.
138051.tagline: Keep your Figma files clean, consistent, and design-system perfect—automatically.

plugins.name: Frames to Auto Layout
plugins.description:
We’ve all done it–selected multiple frames and tried to add auto layout to each of them, only to find that instead of adding auto layout to every frame individually as expected, Figma annoyingly groups all your selected frames and organizes them in a single auto layout.


This simple plugin provides that missing, expected functionality for Figma. With this plugin, simply select all of the frames you want to add auto layout to and run the plugin, and voila—every frame you selected will now have auto layout added, instead of the default Figma behavior of grouping the selected frames within a new frame and organizing your selected layers in a single auto layout—so annoying!


Currently the plugin simply sets the same default auto layout properties that the standard "add auto layout" UI button and command add—horizontal directionality and 10px padding and spacing. I may consider adding to this plugin the ability to configure custom default properties with a separate command—please comment if such a feature would interest you.

accepted.name: Avana Vana
accepted.description:
Senior Product Designer & Full-stack Developer

Currently Design Lead at Co:Create (www.cocreate.ink)

plugins.tagline: Add auto layout to multiple frames individually, instantly.

plugins.name: Prism by lumos
plugins.description:
🌈 Prism by Lumos


A smarter way to manage your Figma color variables


Prism is a powerful, easy-to-use plugin built to help you create, organize, and maintain a clean, scalable color system in Figma. Whether you’re building from scratch or refining an existing system, Prism takes the heavy lifting out of color management.


It’s the same powerful tool we use to power the Lumos Design System — with token-based color management built right in.


⸻


✨ What Prism does best

•🎨 Full Color System

Instantly generate a complete color palette (from 50 to 900) based on your base colors.

•🔗 Semantic Color Mapping

Create semantic color variables that stay linked to your base palette.

•🌗 Light & Dark Theme Support

Effortlessly manage color values for both light and dark modes.

•🧰 Visual Color Editor

Tweak colors visually with a real-time preview — no guesswork required.

•📁 Clean, Organized Structure

Keeps your color variables tidy and consistent with logical naming and folders.

•🧩 Built for Design Tokens

Prism follows a token-based approach inspired by the Lumos Design System, making it easy to plug into any design system workflow.


⸻


Prism helps you focus on what matters — great design — by handling the complexity of color systems behind the scenes. Perfect for design systems, large projects, or anyone who wants a more organized Figma file.

plugins.name: Sizr
plugins.description: Sizr is a Figma plugin designed to streamline the process of resizing elements within a frame. By leveraging the column grid layout of the parent frame, the plugin ensures precise alignment and proportional scaling of selected elements. Whether you’re working with rectangles, text layers, groups, or components, Column Sizr dynamically calculates the appropriate dimensions based on the grid’s column count, margins, and gutter size. Simply select your elements, define the desired number of columns, and let the plugin handle the rest. Ideal for designers aiming for consistency and accuracy in grid-based designs.
plugins.tagline: Resize elements dynamically based on the column grid of their parent frame.

111068.description: Sizr is a Figma plugin designed to streamline the process of resizing elements within a frame. By leveraging the column grid layout of the parent frame, the plugin ensures precise alignment and proportional scaling of selected elements. Whether you’re working with rectangles, text layers, groups, or components, Column Sizr dynamically calculates the appropriate dimensions based on the grid’s column count, margins, and gutter size. Simply select your elements, define the desired number of columns, and let the plugin handle the rest. Ideal for designers aiming for consistency and accuracy in grid-based designs.
111068.release_notes:
Support for Components
Added:
- The plugin now supports resizing elements based on the grid of a parent `COMPONENT` in addition to a `FRAME`.
- Automatically detects whether the parent is a `FRAME` or `COMPONENT` with a valid grid layout.
- Displays appropriate notifications if resizing is restricted (e.g., when dealing with a master component).

Fixed:
- Improved error handling and user feedback for unsupported parent types or missing grid layouts.

How to Use:
1. Select an element within a `FRAME` or `COMPONENT` with a grid.
2. Trigger the plugin to resize compatible elements based on the grid layout.

plugins.name: Node Exporter
plugins.description:
🧩 Node Exporter


Node Exporter is a powerful Figma plugin that lets you extract full or partial JSON data from selected design nodes — including all their children — with just a click.


✨ Features


- 🔍 Inspect any selected nodes in your Figma file

- 🧾 Export all node properties (deep scan via prototype chain)

- ✅ Or choose specific common properties to extract (e.g., name, width, layoutMode)

- 🌳 Recursively includes children of selected nodes

- 💾 Outputs clean, downloadable `.json` files

- ⚡️ Fast, no setup, no code required


---


🚀 How to Use


1. Install the plugin from Figma Community

2. Open your Figma or FigJam file

3. Select one or more nodes

4. Right-click → Plugins → Node Exporter

5. You'll see two options:

- `✨ Export All Properties`: grabs every readable property for all selected nodes and children

- `🔧 Choose Properties to Export`: shows a checkbox list of common properties you can include

6. Click the relevant button and a `.json` file will automatically download!


---


📦 Example Use Cases


- Design-to-code workflows

- Creating component libraries

- Auditing design system properties

- JSON handoff for frontend developers

- Custom design analysis


---


🔐 Permissions


Node Exporter does not require any network access or authentication. All processing is done locally in your editor.


---


🧠 Tech Notes


- Uses JavaScript reflection to walk the prototype chain

- Safe error handling (non-serializable properties skipped)

- Deep export support for nested `children` arrays


---


👨‍💻 Developer Info


Created by Agent Null

Have ideas, feedback or bugs? Open an issue or contribute!
plugins.tagline: Extract all or selected node properties as JSON, including children — quick, clean, and magical!

- 🧾 Export all node properties (deep scan via prototype chain)

- ✅ Or choose specific common properties to extract (e.g., name, width, layoutMode)

- 🌳 Recursively includes children of selected nodes

- 💾 Outputs clean, downloadable `.json` files

- ⚡️ Fast, no setup, no code required


---


🚀 How to Use


1. Install the plugin from Figma Community

2. Open your Figma or FigJam file

3. Select one or more nodes

4. Right-click → Plugins → Node Exporter

5. You'll see two options:

- `✨ Export All Properties`: grabs every readable property for all selected nodes and children

- `🔧 Choose Properties to Export`: shows a checkbox list of common properties you can include

6. Click the relevant button and a `.json` file will automatically download!


---


📦 Example Use Cases


- Design-to-code workflows

- Creating component libraries

- Auditing design system properties

- JSON handoff for frontend developers

- Custom design analysis


---


🔐 Permissions


Node Exporter does not require any network access or authentication. All processing is done locally in your editor.


---


🧠 Tech Notes


- Uses JavaScript reflection to walk the prototype chain

- Safe error handling (non-serializable properties skipped)

- Deep export support for nested `children` arrays


---


👨‍💻 Developer Info


Created by Agent Null

Have ideas, feedback or bugs? Open an issue or contribute!
134892.tagline: Extract all or selected node properties as JSON, including children — quick, clean, and magical!

plugins.name: Syntax Highlighter
plugins.description:
How to use


Applying syntax highlighting colors


  1. Select a text layer containing a code snippet.
  2. Choose a programming language, if required (the plugin will try to identify the language automatically).
  3. Choose a theme.
  4. Toggle include background and line numbers, if required.
  5. Click Apply.


Clearing syntax highlighting colors


  1. Select a text layer containing a formatted code snippet.
  2. Click the Clear formatting button.


Adding custom Visual Studio themes


  1. Open Visual Studio Code.
  2. Install the desired color theme and switch to the theme in Visual Studio Code.
  3. Press Ctrl + Shift + P and run Developer: Generate Color Theme from current settings.
  4. Select the file's contents and copy.
  5. Open the Figma plugin and press the Create a new theme button.
  6. Paste into the Create a new theme dialog and click Save.


Note: This plugin supports up to 10 custom themes.

plugins.name: RTL智能适配助手 RTL Auto Adapt Helper
plugins.description:
介绍

本插件可帮助设计师一键启用或关闭组件的“阿语”属性，用于快速适配阿拉伯语等 RTL（从右至左）语言界面。支持自动识别并批量设置所选节点及其子组件的变量值，提高国际化效率。


功能说明

  1. 自动查找所选组件中的“阿语”变量属性
  2. 一键切换阿语属性值为 on 或 off
  3. 实时统计处理成功和失败的组件数量
  4. 支持递归处理嵌套结构与实例组件


使用方法

  1. 在 Figma 中选中一个或多个组件或画板
  2. 打开插件界面
  3. 点击“启用阿语模式”或“关闭阿语模式”按钮
  4. 查看统计信息，确认处理结果


注意事项

  1. 插件仅处理存在“阿语”变量属性的组件
  2. 若组件未设置该属性，将不会被修改
  3. 暂不支持自动创建属性，请先在组件中配置好“阿语”变量


Introduction

This plugin helps designers quickly toggle the "arabic" component variable on or off, enabling fast RTL layout adaptation for Arabic language support. It recursively updates selected nodes and their nested components for efficient internationalization.


Function Description

  1. Auto-detect components with "arabic" property
  2. Toggle the value between on and off
  3. Recurse through selected frames, groups, and instances
  4. Display real-time stats on successful and failed updates


How to Use

  1. Select one or more frames or components in your Figma file
  2. Launch the plugin
  3. Click “Enable Arabic Mode” or “Disable Arabic Mode”
  4. View results in the summary section


Notes

  1. Only components that already have an "arabic" variable will be updated
  2. The plugin does not create new properties — please define them first
  3. Works best when your design system is RTL-ready

accepted.name: KingweiCheung
accepted.description: Everything gets a response, but nothing gets a resolution. 事事有回应，事事不答应。

plugins.tagline: Smart Arabic mode toggle for RTL-friendly components

plugins.name: Forma
plugins.description:
🎨 FORMA: Design Systems in Minutes, Not Months! 🚀


Ever tried creating a design system from scratch? It's like trying to fold a fitted sheet – seemingly impossible and will probably make you cry. 😭


Forma swoops in to save your sanity with magical design system generation powers:


✨ COLOR SORCERY

• Create gorgeous Pantone-style color palettes

• Generate perfect shades that actually make sense

• Turn chaotic color choices into harmonious design languages


📝 TYPOGRAPHY WIZARDRY

• Conjure complete typography hierarchies faster than you can say "Comic Sans is unacceptable"

• 9 perfectly balanced text styles that your design lead will actually approve

• Font fallbacks that won't make your developers rage-quit


🧩 DESIGN TOKENS

• Spacing systems that maintain mathematical harmony

• Size tokens that scale beautifully across devices

• Consistent radius values (because inconsistent corner radii are criminal)


⚠️ BETA ALERT ⚠️

This release is a preview of Forma's powers - not for production just yet! We're still brewing up more magical features like component generation, brand voice integration, and design consistency checks.


Created with ❤️ (and a lot of coffee) by a designer who got tired of rebuilding the same foundations over and over again.

plugins.name: Numeric Variable Checker
plugins.description:
Numeric Variable Checker は、Figma上で数値のハードコーディング（Variablesが適用されていない数値）を検出し、一覧で確認できるプラグインです。


対象は、padding・spacing・width・height・cornerRadius・strokeWeight などの数値プロパティ。


Variablesが未適用の数値だけを抽出し、親子階層を含めて再帰的にチェック。

該当のフレームにはワンクリックでジャンプできます。


-


Numeric Variable Checker is a Figma plugin that helps you detect and list raw numeric values in your design—such as padding, spacing, width, height, corner radius, and stroke weight—that are not yet connected to Variables.


Whether you're building a design system or refining your layout for scalability, this plugin ensures your numbers are consistent, maintainable, and tokenized.


It recursively scans all selected frames and their children, highlights unbound values, and lets you jump to each frame with one click.
plugins.tagline: For designs that stay consistent down to the pixel.

plugins.name: SPLOC - Selected the parent of component layer
plugins.description:
A plugin for Figma that automatically selects the parent component when any child within the component or its instance is selected.


Main features:

  1. Automatic detection and selection of the parent component
  2. Automatic collapse of the selected component
  3. On/Off switch to enable/disable functionality
  4. Memories the last selection to prevent cyclic selections


How to use:

  1. Install the plugin
  2. Launch the plugin (it is active by default)
  3. Select any element within the component or its instance
  4. The plugin will automatically:
  5. Finds the parent component
  6. Select it
  7. Flattens the structure of the component


Interface:

  1. Compact window with ON/OFF switch
  2. The switch allows you to temporarily disable plugin functionality


Technical features:

  1. Works with components (COMPONENT) and their instances (INSTANCE)
  2. Prevents cyclic selections
  3. Optimized for working with large files
  4. Minimal impact on Figma performance


Application:

Ideal for working with large component systems where switching between children and parent components is often required.


----------------------------------------



Плагин для Figma, который автоматически выделяет родительский компонент при выборе любого дочернего элемента внутри компонента или его экземпляра.


Основные возможности:

  1. Автоматическое определение и выбор родительского компонента
  2. Автоматическое схлопывание (collapse) выбранного компонента
  3. Переключатель On/Off для включения/отключения функционала
  4. Запоминание последнего выбора для предотвращения циклических выделений


Как использовать:

  1. Установите плагин
  2. Запустите плагин (он активен по умолчанию)
  3. Выберите любой элемент внутри компонента или его экземпляра
  4. Плагин автоматически:
  5. Найдет родительский компонент
  6. Выделит его
  7. Схлопнет структуру компонента


Интерфейс:

  1. Компактное окно с переключателем ON/OFF
  2. Переключатель позволяет временно отключить функционал плагина


Технические особенности:

  1. Работает с компонентами (COMPONENT) и их экземплярами (INSTANCE)
  2. Предотвращает циклические выделения
  3. Оптимизирован для работы с большими файлами
  4. Минимальное влияние на производительность Figma


Применение:

Идеально подходит для работы с большими компонентными системами, где часто требуется переключение между дочерними элементами и родительскими компонентами.
plugins.tagline: Automatically selects parent component when child layer is selected
